bugs.title: CVE-2023-3430 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in file src/gif.imageio/gifinput.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-3430 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in file src/gif.imageio/gifinput.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-3430 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in file src/gif.imageio/gifinput.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in OpenImageIO, where heap-buffer-overflow exists in file src/gif.imageio/gifinput.cpp.

References:
https://github.com/OpenImageIO/oiio/issues/3840

Created OpenImageIO tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2218381]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2218382]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2218380

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

severity=medium

# Description of your update

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds

======

bugs.title: CVE-2023-36183 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in ICOInput::readimg() in icoinput.cpp [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-36183 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in ICOInput::readimg() in icoinput.cpp [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-36183 OpenImageIO: heap-buffer-overflow in ICOInput::readimg() in icoinput.cpp

long_desc.thetext:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in OpenImageIO v.2.4.12.0 and before allows a remote to execute arbitrary code and obtain sensitive information via a crafted file to the readimg function.

https://github.com/OpenImageIO/oiio/issues/3871

Created OpenImageIO tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2219518]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2219517]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2219516

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.
